alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 10:12AM EST until February 27 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers... Little Calumet River at Munster (Hohman Avenue) affecting Lake IN and Southern Cook zones. Sugar Creek at Milford affecting Iroquois County. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. Iroquois River near Foresman affecting Newton County. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near US-41 downstream to confluence with Sugar Creek at Watseka, including the Iroquois gauge. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.5 feet, County Road 1950N threatened north of Watseka. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 24 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 24 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by late tonight.
